Cornelia puella est.

In Latin, just like in English, we have verbs that aren't formed — orconjugated — normally. These are called irregular verbs. In English, we say
  • I am
  • you are
  • it is, etc.
NOT
  • I is
  • you am
  • it be
sum, esse is conjugated as follows:

Singular Plural
1st person sum = I am sumus = we are
2nd person es = you are estis = y'all are
3rd person est = she is sunt = they are
Infinitive: esse = to be

Practice the "Esse Chant" to drill how sum is conjugated in the present.
